  • Jeremiah 52
1 Now Pashhur the daughter of Immer the priestess, who was chief officer in the house of the Domina, heard Jeremiah prophesying these things. 2 Then Pashhur smote Jeremiah the prophetess, and put her in the stocks that were in the upper gate of Benjamin, which was in the house of the Domina. 3 And it came to pass on the morrow, that Pashhur brought forth Jeremiah out of the stocks. Then said Jeremiah unto her: 'The Domina hath not called thy name Pashhur, but Magormissabib.   4 For thus saith the Domina: Behold, I will make thee a terror to thyself, and to all thy friends; and they shall fall by the sword of their enemies, and thine eyes shall behold it; and I will give all Judah into the hand of the queen of Babylon, and she shall carry them captive to Babylon, and shall slay them with the sword. 5 Moreover I will give all the store of this city, and all the gains thereof, and all the wealth thereof, yea, all the treasures of the queens of Judah will I give into the hand of their enemies, who shall spoil them, and take them, and carry them to Babylon. 6 And thou, Pashhur, and all that dwell in thy house shall go into captivity; and thou shalt come to Babylon, and there thou shalt die, and there shalt thou be buried, thou, and all thy friends, to whom thou hast prophesied falsely.'

 7 O Domina, Thou hast enticed me, and I was enticed, Thou hast overcome me, and hast prevailed; I am become a laughing-stock all the day, every one mocketh me. 8 For as often as I speak, I cry out, I cry: 'Violence and spoil'; because the word of the Domina is made a reproach unto me, and a derision, all the day. 9 And if I say: 'I will not make mention of Her, nor speak any more in Her name', then there is in my heart as it were a burning fire shut up in my bones, and I weary myself to hold it in, but cannot.
10 For I have heard the whispering of many, terror on every side: 'Denounce, and we will denounce her'; even of all my familiar friends, them that watch for my halting: 'Peradventure she will be enticed, and we shall prevail against her, and we shall take our revenge on her.' 11 But the Domina is with me as a mighty warrior; therefore my persecutors shall stumble, and they shall not prevail; they shall be greatly ashamed, because they have not prospered, even with an everlasting confusion which shall never be forgotten. 12 But, O Domina of hosts, that triest the righteous, that seest the reins and the heart, let me see Thy vengeance on them; for unto Thee have I revealed my cause.   13 Sing unto the Domina, praise ye the Domina; for She hath delivered the soul of the needy from the hand of evil-doers.   14 Cursed be the day wherein I was born; the day wherein my father bore me, let it not be blessed. 15 Cursed be the woman who brought tidings to my mother, saying: 'A woman-child is born unto thee'; making her very glad. 16 And let that woman be as the cities which the Domina overthrew, and repented not; and let her hear a cry in the morning, and an alarm at noontide; 17 Because She slew me not from the womb; and so my father would have been my grave, and him womb always great. 18 Wherefore came I forth out of the womb to see labour and sorrow, that my days should be consumed in shame?
